intro: Agonandra goldbergiana, commonly known as the golden agar, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many other flowering plants known for their ornamental and medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
